projects.name: Snake Game
projects.description:
Link: Snake CodePen

Description: Based on the classic Snake game, this is one of the great practical projects within the Exercism Bootcamp. When the game starts, a small snake appears on the screen and it can be moved using the arroy keys on the keyboard. A white particle appears on random parts of the game area, for the snake to eat said particles and grow longer. If the snake's head clashes with the edge of the area or against its own body, the game ends on a loss.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JS.

projects.name: Breakout Game
projects.description:
Link: Breakout CodePen

Description: Based on the classic Breakout game, this is one of the great practical projects within the Exercism Bootcamp. It involves creating a few rows of colored blocks and a ball that moves around, bouncing off the game area's edges and a paddle, breaking the blocks on touch and displaying different messages based on a win or a loss.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JS.

projects.name: La Torre
projects.description:
Forum version: phpBB3

Hosted by: ForoActivo

Link: La Torre

Purpose: Collaborative redesign project for a long-standing narrative role-play forum, working alongside other users to refresh its visual identity and user experience.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript — integrated through ForoActivo’s customization panel, which allows access to HTML templates, the main CSS file, and additional JS scripting.

My Role: Contributed to HTML and CSS adjustments for layout and structure, and collaborated on selecting images and defining the color palette for a cohesive visual theme.

projects.name: PHP Forum
projects.description:
Purpose: Started as a hands-on way to learn Bootstrap, this project quickly grew into a more ambitious goal: building a complete, customizable forum system while practicing core web development skills.

Concept: Inspired by phpBB forums and my past experience with them. While the forum doesn't have a specific theme yet, it serves as a base for experimenting with web development techniques and simulating real-world features.

Current technologies: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap 5, PHP, MySQL, XAMPP

Planned features:

  • Extended profile system with editable user information.
  • Integration of a rich text editor (e.g., BBCode or CKEditor—or potentially a custom-built solution).
  • Admin panel for content and user management.
  • Visual refinement and final design adjustments.
  • Usability improvements and interface polishing.
